treatment.reference: Nitrogen fixation at 92˚C by a hydrothermal vent archaeon Science 314:1783-1784
treatment.description: Isolated from deep-sea hydrothermal vent fluid. Reduces N2 to NH3 up to 92˚C. Capable of growth from 58˚C to 92˚C in a medium containing marine salts and H2 plus CO2. Optimal growth temperature of 90˚C.
